result.execSummary:
The defendant Tami M Kratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tami M Kratz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:14 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine, AODA and DNA surcharge.  Defendant concurs.  State concurs.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-AODA & any follow-up - to be completed within 60 days and proof of completion to be filed with the DA's office and COC office.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:20 a.m.
